hints.content:
Horse Haven has $\greenD{49}$ ponies.  How many pictures are above Horse Haven on the picture graph?

[[☃ image 1]]

$\blueD7$ pictures are above Horse Haven.  

$\blueD7 \times \,\maroonD? = \greenD{49}$

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Ranch and the vertical axis labeled Number of ponies. Each ranch is listed along the horizontal axis from left to right as follows: Horse Haven, Pony Pasture, and Equine Lodge. The number of ponies in each ranch is represented by the number of pictures of ponies plotted on the graph. Horse Haven is represented by 7 pictures of ponies, Pony Pasture is represented by 4 pictures of ponies, and Equine Lodge is represented by 5 pictures of ponies. 7 pictures of ponies above Horse Haven are labeled from 1 at the bottom to 7 at the top. !

hints.content:
$\blueD7 \times \maroonD{7} = \greenD{49}$

Let's see if $\maroonD{7}$ works for the other ranches.

[[☃ image 1]]

Ranch  || Number of ponies 
:- | :-: | :-: 
Horse Haven| $\blueD7  \times \maroonD{7} = \greenD{49}$| $\greenD{49}$ 
Pony Pasture |$\gray4  \times \maroonD{7}  = \greenD{28}$| $\greenD{28}$ 
Equine Lodge| $\purpleC5  \times \maroonD{7} = \greenD{35}$| $\greenD{35}$

options.alt: A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Ranch and the vertical axis labeled Number of ponies. Each ranch is listed along the horizontal axis from left to right as follows: Horse Haven, Pony Pasture, and Equine Lodge. The number of ponies in each ranch is represented by the number of pictures of ponies plotted on the graph. Horse Haven is represented by 7 pictures of ponies, Pony Pasture is represented by 4 pictures of ponies, and Equine Lodge is represented by 5 pictures of ponies. 4 pictures of ponies above Pony Pasture are labeled from 1 at the bottom to 4 at the top. 5 pictures of ponies above Equine Lodge are labeled from 1 at the bottom to 5 at the top. !

hints.content:
On the picture graph, each

[[☃ image 1]]

equals $\maroonD{7}$ ponies.

question.content:
Purdy Pony created a chart and a picture graph to show how many of his pony friends live at each of the ranches in town.





Ranch  | Number of ponies 
:- | :-: 
Horse Haven | $49$ 
Pony Pasture | $28$ 
Equine Lodge | $35$ 



[[☃ image 1]]

[[☃ image 2]]


**On the picture graph, each**

[[☃ image 3]]

**equals [[☃ input-number 2]] ponies.**

options.alt: A picture of a pony equals question mark ponies. !

A picture graph shows the horizontal axis labeled Ranch and the vertical axis labeled Number of ponies. Each ranch is listed along the horizontal axis from left to right as follows: Horse Haven, Pony Pasture, and Equine Lodge. The number of ponies in each ranch is represented by the number of pictures of ponies plotted on the graph. Horse Haven is represented by 7 pictures of ponies, Pony Pasture is represented by 4 pictures of ponies, and Equine Lodge is represented by 5 pictures of ponies. !
